guidelines:
NOTE: We observe maximal growth with open ocean seawater (i.e. Sargasso seawater), though we can routinely grow Prochlorococcus in some coastal seawater (from Cape Cod, MA) as well.

Table 1. Nutrient additions to filtered, autoclaved seawater
Nutrient Manufacturer/Grade  Primary Stock (M)  Dilution Factor  Final Conc. (µM) Sigma Cat. No.
NaH2PO4·H2O  (1) / ACS  0.025  1:500  50 (MK7892-04)
NH4Cl  (1) / ACS 0.50  1:625  800 (MK3384-12)
Na2EDTA·2 H2O  (2) / 99%  0.012  1:104  1.17 E4884-100g
FeCl3·6 H2O  (1) / Analytic  0.012  1:104  1.18 44944-50g
ZnSO4·7 H2O  (3) / >99.5%  0.080  1:107  0.008 204986-10g
CoCl2·6 H2O  (1) / Analytic  0.050  1:107  0.005 60820-50g
MnCl2·4 H2O  (1) / Analytic  0.900  1:107  0.090 M3634-100g
Na2MoO4·2 H2O (2) / ACS  0.030  1:107  0.003 M1651-100g
Na2SeO3  (2) / ~98%  0.100  1:107  0.010 S5261-25g
NiCl2·6 H2O  (1) / Analytic  0.100  1:107  0.010 223387-25g
Manufacturer Index: (1) Mallinckrodt, (2) Sigma, (3) Fluka Note 2/6/12: Mallinckrodt and Fluka no longer available; ordered all reagents from Sigma at same grade as specified.

Note 4/28/08:
Matt suggested higher concentrations of NH4Cl and NaH2PO4 so only use 0.5ml per 1L seawater:
1.6M NH4Cl     2.14g/25ml or 8.56g/100ml
0.1M NaH2PO4-H2O     0.345g/25ml or 1.38g/100ml
Trace metal working stock 100µl

components.data: Stock and Trace Metal Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.description: Preparation of trace metal stock solutions for cyanobacteria trace metal mixture (CTMM)
source_data.before_start:
Before culturing cyanobacteria, read the publication by L.R. Moore et. al. (2007) Limnol. Oceanogr. 5: 353-362.
Purchase the highest quality chemicals to avoid trace metal contamination. 
Acid-wash all re-uesable containers.
source_data.protocol_affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University
source_data.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

versions.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

authors_list.name: Matthew Sullivan Lab
authors_list.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University

source_data.guidelines:
Prepare stock trace metal solutions using the amounts below for 100 mL or (50 mL) volumes:

2.30g (1.15g) ZnSO4·7H2O
1.19g (0.595g) CoCl2·6H2O
17.81g (8.905g) MnCl2·4H2O
0.726g (0.636g) Na2MoO4·2H2O
1.73g (0.865g) Na2SeO3
2.38g (1.19g) NiCl2·6H2O

components.data:
Using dust-free weigh paper, weigh out:
2.30g ZnSO4·7H2O
 1.19g CoCl2·6H2O
 17.81g MnCl2·4H2O
 0.726g Na2MoO4·2H2O
 1.73g Na2SeO3
 2.38g NiCl2·6H2O

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Primary trace metal stocks
source_data.annotation: All reagents used for culturing cyanobacteria should be the highest quality to avoid contamination by trace metals.  Do not use metal spatulas for dispensing the chemicals (use plastic, teflon, or dust-free weighing paper to dispense).  Store reagents in acid-washed teflon or polycarbonate containers.
source_data.thread_text: All reagents used for culturing cyanobacteria should be the highest quality to avoid contamination by trace metals.  Do not use metal spatulas for dispensing the chemicals (use plastic, teflon, or dust-free weighing paper to dispense).  Store reagents in acid-washed teflon or polycarbonate containers.
source_data.body: All reagents used for culturing cyanobacteria should be the highest quality to avoid contamination by trace metals.  Do not use metal spatulas for dispensing the chemicals (use plastic, teflon, or dust-free weighing paper to dispense).  Store reagents in acid-washed teflon or polycarbonate containers.
source_data.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Primary trace metal stocks
source_data.annotation:
Use the highest quality chemicals that are dedicated for cyanobacteria work.
Do not use metal spatulas to transfer chemicals; use plastic or teflon spatulas or dust-free weigh paper to weigh out chemicals.
All re-useable glassware or plastic should be acid-washed and then autoclaved.
source_data.thread_text:
Use the highest quality chemicals that are dedicated for cyanobacteria work.
Do not use metal spatulas to transfer chemicals; use plastic or teflon spatulas or dust-free weigh paper to weigh out chemicals.
All re-useable glassware or plastic should be acid-washed and then autoclaved.
source_data.body:
Use the highest quality chemicals that are dedicated for cyanobacteria work.
Do not use metal spatulas to transfer chemicals; use plastic or teflon spatulas or dust-free weigh paper to weigh out chemicals.
All re-useable glassware or plastic should be acid-washed and then autoclaved.

components.data: Stock and Trace Metal Preparation
components.name: Section

source_data.description: Preparation of the trace metal mixture for addition to seawater for the cultivation of marine cyanobacteria, Prochlorococcus and Synechococcus
source_data.before_start:
Prepare the six trace metal stock solutions as described in the Primary Trace Metal Stocks protocol:
  • 0.08M ZnSO4·7H2O ((2.30 g/100 mL)
  • 0.05M CoCl2·6H2O (1.19 g/100 mL)
  • 0.90M MnCl2·4H2O (17.81 g/100 mL)
  • 0.03M Na2MoO4·2H2O (0.726 g/100m mL)
  • 0.10M Na2SeO3 (1.73 g/100 mL)
  • 0.10M NiCl2·6H2O (2.38 g/100 mL)
source_data.protocol_affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University
source_data.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

versions.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, The Ohio State University

authors_list.name: Matthew Sullivan Lab
authors_list.affiliation: Matthew Sullivan Lab, University of Arizona, Ohio State University

source_data.guidelines:
All chemicals used for cultivating cyanobacteria should be of the highest quality.
All re-useable glassware and plastic should be acid-washed and autoclaved.
Use only plastic or teflon spatulas or dust-free weigh paper for weighing out chemicals.

components.data: Individually add and dissolve 100 µl of each of the six primary trace metal stocks described in the Primary Trace Metal Stocks protocol.  The six primary trace metals to add are ZnSO<sub>4</sub>, CoCl<sub>2</sub>, MnCl<sub>2</sub>, Na<sub>2</sub>MoO<sub>4</sub>, Na<sub>2</sub>SeO<sub>3</sub> and NiCl<sub>2</sub>.

components.data:
To make up the media, add following volumes of sterile nutrients and trace metal stock to one liter of the autoclaved seawater
Nutrient Volume
Filtered Seawater    1000.0mL
0.5M NH4Cl    1.6mL
0.025M NaH2PO4·H2O     2.0mL
Trace metal working stock    100µL
